Plot a genome-wide scatter plot of coverage.

Source: R/plot_depth.R
plot_depth.Rd

@description Plot a genome-wide scatter plot of mutation depths, downsampled if required (annotates the used proportion).

plot_depth(x, N = 5000, chromosomes = paste0("chr", c(1:22, "X", "Y")))

Arguments

x

An object of class cnaqc, created by the init function.
N

Mutations to use, randomly sampled.
chromosomes

The chromosome to use for this plot.

Value

A ggplot object.

Examples

data('example_dataset_CNAqc', package = 'CNAqc')
x = init(example_dataset_CNAqc$snvs, example_dataset_CNAqc$cna,example_dataset_CNAqc$purity)
#>  [ CNAqc - CNA Quality Check ] 
#>

plot_depth(x)

plot_depth(x, N = 100)
plot_depth(x, N = 1000)
plot_depth(x, N = 10000)
